theory.idea: <head>The idea</head><par>The hard part of our current situation is that we have a <term>fraction inside of a fraction</term>. We know how to <skill-link>multiply and divide fractions with numbers</skill-link>, and how the terms are reordered to turn any fraction of fractions into a single fraction. When using variables, it works the same way! After all, <inline-math/> is just as much a number as (for instance) the number <inline-math/>.</par><par>Using these default rules, we may rewrite <block-math/> Once we have done this, we are left with a <term>single fraction</term>. We are already familiar with <skill-link>simplifying a fraction</skill-link> like this. We cross out factors, both for the number (a factor <inline-math/>) and for the variables (two factors <inline-math/>) to wind up with <block-math/> This is as simple as it can possibly be written.</par>
